meanings.definition: One who fusses or complains excessively.
meanings.sent1: The little fusser always finds something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: My aunt is a fusser when things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: The fusser at the restaurant sent back his food three times!
meanings.sent4: She's such a fusser, always nitpicking every little detail.
meanings.sent5: The fusser in the office drives everyone crazy with his constant complaints.

meanings.sent1: During the meeting, he couldn't stop fussering in his seat.
meanings.sent2: Children tend to fusser when they have to sit still for too long.
meanings.sent3: The dog began to fusser around the room, unable to stay still.
meanings.sent4: The leaves on the tree fussered in the wind, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: She fussered with her hair nervously while waiting for the interview.

meanings.definition: To handle or arrange something in a fussy or overly detailed manner.
meanings.sent1: She would fusser over the table setting for hours before guests arrived.
meanings.sent2: He tends to fusser with his tools, organizing them meticulously.
meanings.sent3: The chef began to fusser with the garnish, adding tiny details.
meanings.sent4: The artist fussered over every brushstroke, striving for perfection.
meanings.sent5: She fussered with the puzzle pieces, trying to fit them together just right.
